title: ‚ÄúUsing R more "wisely": Column-wise and row-wise operations with dplyr ‚Äú
description:
We cordially invite you to a workshop on ‚ÄúUsing R more "wisely": Column-wise and row-wise operations with dplyr ‚Äú scheduled on tuesday, 24th November, 18:30 p.m. GMT+1

In this workshop you‚Äôll learn dplyr‚Äôs approach centred around the row-wise and the column-wise data frame.

Trainer: Brendan Cullen, Doctoral Student | NSF GRFP Fellow,Department of Psychology, University of Oregon, and RStudio Certified Instructor in the tidyverse. bcullen.rbind.io

The workshop will be hosted online via Zoom

We look forward to e-meeting you!

title: Introduction to R  Packages Development
description:
R-Ladies Algiers and R-Ladies Tunis are partnering up and are hosting a workshop about R packages development that will be animated by Shel Kariuki https://shelkariuki.netlify.app/ During this workshop you'll learn about how to create an R package from scratch.

Prerequisites : Basic knowledge of R.

Date/Time : Saturday, October 10, 2020 5PM -> 7PM (GMT+1)

Place : Zoom https://zoom.us/download

Invited speaker : ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Shel Kariuki : Senior Data Analyst

‚ñ∂Ô∏è About Shel kariuki : Shel is a Senior Data Analyst based in Nairobi, Kenyaa. She's an RStudio Certified Tidyverse trainer, and recently worked as a Research Manager at Geopoll, and as a Data Analyst at Busara Center for Behavioral Economics. She has previously worked as an assistant lecturer in various Kenyan universities, teaching units in Statistics and Actuarial Science. Shel has a Bsc in Actuarial Science and Msc in Applied Statistics from JKUAT. She has extensive experience in data analysis using R and Python. She co-organizes a community of R users in Nairobi #NairobiR and in Africa #AfricaR. One of the missions of her community work is to make sure that they have an increased number of R adopters, in Africa. Shel is very passionate about training and using data analytics to drive development projects in Africa.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form üëâ https://tinyurl.com/yaah9y2n Those who fill out the form will receive an email shortly with instructions on how to join.

We look forward to e-meeting you!

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us ‚¨áÔ∏è

title: R-Ladies Algiers third meetup
description: R-Ladies is a global organization which aims to achieve proportionate representation by encouraging, inspiring and empowering gender people currently under-represented in the R community. Therefore, the main objective of R-Ladies is to to help minority genre R fans realize their programming potential, by creating a collaborative global network of R leaders, mentors, learners and developers to facilitate individual and collective progress around the world. And it is by following this vision that we have created R-ladeis algiers which will organize its third meet-up (the second online) on Saturday June 13, 2020 at 3 p.m. via ZOOM.
